column4: hey guys.  any ideas on how to get an optical sound port to work?
analog works
no luck with digital:(
you should be able to use alsaconf and select the spdif output.
i'm looking at a fiber channel... not spidif
your trying to use the optical output?
that is spdif ;)
and yes, alsaconf is console.
ha... thanks.. I used to seeing units with both a spdif (looks like rca) and optical (fiber channel)
yeah the RCa looking one is called coaxial digital, optical is spdif
so how do I use the command?  I'm pretty new to console
in console type "alsaconf"
sudo apt-get install alsaconf
disregard that, let me find the package that includes that
sudo apt-get install alsa-utils-gui (then you should have the guified version)
that you so much for the helping hand
sudo nano /etc/apt/source.list
what is nano?
a texteditor.
when in doubt type "man <commandhere> to find out what it is
oooh... thanks
got my spdif to work... you rock
cool, glad to hear it.
